intro: Sphaeralcea glabrescens, commonly known as the pale globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its glandular, hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. The plant produces showy, yellow to orange flowers that are typically arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert and semi-arid environments. Sphaeralcea glabrescens is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
